item.title: Last showing is cancelled due to Coronavirus
item.dc:creator: Glenn Hutchings
item.description: You won't be too surprised to hear that we've decided to cancel the April showings at the Zonita, due to the ongoing Coronavirus outbreak. Apologies to all who were looking forward to those movies; we may move them to the start of the next season instead (planned for September). Until then, stay safe!

item.title: Change of email address
item.dc:creator: Glenn Hutchings
item.description: You may or may not be aware that we have recently had problems with our emailÂ system, and missed some bookings for the February showing. As a result, we've decided to move the Zonita email address to a more reliable one, at zonitacinema@gmail.com. You can also send email to the Zonita's Facebook email address: zonita.ampthill@gmail.com. The old info@zonita.org.uk address may still work for now, and will still be shown on posters for a while, but we ask that you use the new address when reserving tickets and tables from now on.

item.title: Largest ever turnout for Fisherman's Friends
item.dc:creator: Glenn Hutchings
item.description:
We had our largest ever audience last night, for the showing of Fisherman's Friends. Thanks to all who came along, and a very big thanks to the Sloop Groggy Dogs for putting on a great show! They very kindly donated their time and singing skills for free, instead having a collection for the RNLI.

item.title: Sloop Groggy Dogs to play at Fisherman's Friends showing!
item.dc:creator: Glenn Hutchings
item.description:
Just before the January 11 showing of Fisherman's Friends, the local band Sloop Groggy Dogs will be singing some traditional songs of the sea, including some lively shanties. Come along and join in!

The band will be on at 7pm, and the movie will start a bit later than usual, at 7:30. They will also be playing for 20 minutes during the interval.

item.description: The Tickets page now has a bit more information on how to make reservations for tickets and tables.

item.title: Site is up again
item.dc:creator: Glenn Hutchings
item.description:
Well, if you're reading this, the site is back up again. It has been unavailable since the 5th October, when our web host had a file system failure.

Sorry about the inconvenience! Unfortunately there was nothing we could do about it except wait for the problem to be resolved. Judging by the frequency of previous problems (which you can see here), this amount of downtime was pretty unusual.

item.title: 2017/18 season is open for ideas
item.dc:creator: Glenn Hutchings
item.description:
The Spring 2017 season is now over. We hope you'll agree there were some excellent movies!

We are reviewing our Autumn 2017 and Spring 2018 movie line up, both matinee and evening. All ideas and suggestions are welcome, whether a classic, thriller, hollywood, or musical. Why not write and let us know? You can either leave a comment on this page, or email us at info@zonita.org.uk.

item.title: Website improvements
item.dc:creator: Glenn Hutchings
item.description:
I've added a few new features recently. On the main page:

  • You can see what films are on at the next showing, and when it is
  • There's a summary of the most recent news items (like this one)

For each movie on the What's On page:

  • There's a movie rating icon, which links to the BBFC guide for that rating
  • Next to the rating, there's a list of genres for the movie
  • There's also a link to the YouTube trailer (if available)

If you have any ideas for other stuff you'd like to see on the site, let me know (at the usual email address below).

item.title: Zonita on the Web

item.description:

item.title: 2016/17 season confirmed
item.dc:creator: Glenn Hutchings
item.description: Thanks to everyone who sent in movie suggestions for the 2016/17 season. We've finalized the new lineup, which you can find here. If your idea didn't make it this time, it will certainly be up for consideration next season.
